intro: Ruellia holm-nielsenii, commonly known as the Hawaiian ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces blue or violet flowers that are attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
